folder: Boston Road & Jefferson Place, Bronx, NY
text:
1361 to 1365 Boston Road, adjoining the S.W. corner of Jefferson Place, showing the Jennings Homestead, also known as the "Old Stone Jug" and "Drovers' Inn." It was built in the middle of the 18th century. Its site is now (G.W. Bromley map of 1923 as revised to September 1932) occupied by a 5-story apartment house (No. 1361-63) and a 1-story brick-structure (No. 1365). For additional data see The Story of the Bronx, Page 35 by R. Comfort.

1901.

Gift of Randall Comfort.
